2:
Yahweh will preserve him and keep him alive,
\q and he will be blessed on the earth;
\q Yahweh will not turn him over to the will of his enemies.
\q
3:
Yahweh will support him on the bed of suffering;
\q you will make his bed of sickness into a bed of healing.
4:
I said, "Yahweh, have mercy on me!
\q Heal me, for I have sinned against you."
\q
5:
My enemies speak evil against me, saying,
\q 'When will he die and his name perish?'
\q
9:
Indeed, even my own close friend, in whom I trusted,
\q who ate my bread,
\q has lifted up his heel against me.
10:
But you, Yahweh, have mercy on me and raise me up
\q so that I may pay them back.
\q
11:
By this I know that you delight in me,
\q for my enemy does not triumph over me.
\q
12:
As for me, you support me in my integrity
\q and will keep me before your face forever.
13:
May Yahweh, the God of Israel be praised
\q from everlasting to everlasting.
\q Amen and Amen.
41:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of David.
\q
